children: One or more objectively confirmed episodes of arterial, venous, or small vessel thrombosis occurring in any tissue or organ
One or more unexplained deaths of a morphologically normal fetus at or beyond the 10th week of gestation; or
One or more premature births of a morphologically normal neonate before the 34th week of gestation because of eclampsia, pre-eclampsia, or placental insufficiency; or
Three or more unexplained consecutive spontaneous abortions before the 10th week of gestation
Lupus anticoagulant, detected according to the guidelines of the International Society on Thrombosis and Haemostasis
Anticardiolipin antibody of IgG and/or IgM isotype, present in medium or high titer (greater than 40 GPL or MPL, or greater than the 99th percentile), measured by a standardized ELISA
-glycoprotein-1 antibody of IgG and/or IgM isotype, present in titer greater than the 99th percentile, measured by a standardized ELISA

footnotes: ELISA = enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay; GPL = specificity for IgG phospholipid antigens; MPL = specificity for IgM phospholipid antigens.
